p: Inspired by the advantages of hollow, polar, interweaving surface structure, and catalytic activity of Co for Na–S batteries, we synthesized hollow polar bipyramid prism cobalt chalcogenides and used them as sulfur hosts. The bipyramid prisms of cobalt were synthesized by simple reflux methods (see “Methods” section). The X-ray diffraction (XRD) pattern confirmed the formation of C 10H 16Co 3O 11 and was attributed to the standard PDF of JCPDS#22-0582, as shown in Supplementary Fig. 1.
